params.text:
A therapist should always use the principle of “Do no harm”.

The therapist's aim should always be around supporting the client to empower them to seek the answers themselves. This can be achieved by being curious about personal self-development and knowledge, especially around safeguarding.

As therapists may deal with a range of people from different backgrounds and it’s important to recognize who to get support from when coming across a situation that may be difficult.

It is vital to recognize how to find the balance between confidentiality and protecting someone who could be vulnerable.  This is why, a therapist needs to ensure that they seek out support from the right people or organizations when an issue falls outside of the therapist's remit or skillset - the principle of “Do no harm”, should be at the forefront of a therapist's practice.

panels.title: Using the principle of "Do no harm"
